creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
If the nested <sequential> is required, and no substitute is possible (as was 
the case in the beginning when a <parallel> was also allowed), then isn't it 
just a waste of 25 keystrokes to include it?

I am rejected this for three reasons:
1) there may be future tasks/types with the name element or attribute
2) It may be too easy to mix the attribute/element with the
   contents of the macro:

<macrodef name="show">
  <echo> a is ${a}</echo>
  <property name="inmacro" value="Set in macro"/>
  <attribute name="a" default="a an attribute"/>
  <x/>
  <element name="x"/>
</macrodef>

3) Making the mods would not be worth the gain.

Peter
creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com

text:
Just a comment,

Maybe it would have been better had we used <body> instead of <sequential>.
The reason being that <sequential> is the name of an existing task
while something like <body> will be describing just the syntactic
structure of a <macrodef>. So it would look something like:

<macrodef name="X">
  <attribute name="q"/>
  <element name="w"/>
  <body>
    <echo> blah blah blah</echo>
    <w/>
  </body>
</macrodef>
